intro: Astragalus hoantchy, commonly known as the Hoantchy milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, including parts of China and Mongolia. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with numerous small leaflets, and it produces cylindrical pods that contain several seeds. Astragalus hoantchy is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
